author: Thai Huynh
text: Completely untrustworthy site for the fact that a buyer may not even receive their purchased item. This is exactly what happened to me. The first time I reported this, my issue was not resolved and the agent I worked with brushed me off. Then another agent assisted me and finally granted me the refund I needed in the first place. This is after countless emails sent back and forth over a matter of weeks. The agents also ask for screenshots for emails with THEIR agents. Completely ridiculous process. Buying and selling on Grailed is a gamble.
title: Unhelpful and Delayed Assistance

author: TK
text:
Grailed customer service has been top notch. I worked with Michael in their support area.  He was always very professional, responsive and saw my case through to the end.  

After using PayPal for decades with zero claims, to say I was upset when they failed to honor their “protection” the first time I filed one  is an understatement.  Their message to me indicated the item was “similar”. They either have BOTs now reviewing claims or are uneducated on the luxury resell market. When you buy a high end piece of designer jewelry, “similar” is not okay. 

What was listed was a Versace necklace with clear bright stones all in tact. What I received was missing stones and those present were mostly discolored to the point of being grey - black. While the item I received was authentic and was a Versace necklace, the condition was very poor, not as described, and not even close to being as pictured. 

Michael at Grailed helped me from the day I received the misrepresented item, through the entire process with PayPal and then saw it to the end by honoring their customer commitment of resolving all issues and protecting customers when it doesn’t get resolved through PayPal. 

I have lost all faith on any “protection” from PayPal, but I will absolutely continue to buy on Grailed because of their service, attentiveness to the issue and their commitment to seeing it through to resolution, even when PayPal fails to do so.
title: Grailed stepped in when PayPal failed!

author: Mike Iso
text: I list on all the major apps but grailed just keeps going above and beyond. i had a customer purchase a $2500 pair of cartier glasses on the wrong card so i refunded him so he can put it on a new one. But the item didnt automatically get listed to my feed again. i reached out and gavin from the grailed team got back to me within the hour i reposted the item they made sure to expedite authentication because it had already been verified and it was back up in minutes so my customer could finish checking out. Great experience with them and my customer was happy. Etsy, poshmark and ebay can learn a thing or two from them by helping their sellers instead of doing everything in their power to screw them.
title: Grailed saved the day and my $2500 sale...

author: Adrian Morris
text: Grailed has been going down for years. When I first discovered this site. It was wayyy better. Now they have falsely authentic items being passed as authentic. They use an “authentic” banner for items that’re not authentic. I was once sold some fake Balenciaga Triple S sneakers (which PayPal refunded me. This time some fake Saint Laurent jeans. I tried to resell them and them deemed them fake. How?! When I bought them from the site in the first place and they use a digital authentication system. Makes no sense. After about a week of back and forth emailing, I was refunded my money. I won’t be doing too much shopping from here in the future.
title: Grailed has been going down for years

author: Poz S
text: grailed should be shut down. Firstly all the positive reviews are of people who were scammed and then got their money back? That’s not a good thing. Secondly, grailed allows for stolen items to be sold on the website. There’s been an influx of stuff from ukraine so they also allow war victim goods to be illegally sold. There’s no authenticity process. Take a look at stockx and compare. Grailed is a pawn shop; worse than Craigslist. No seller on grailed will ever have an original box or document. Most of it is stolen or counterfeit. For those of you living in a 1990s good will overcome bubble and wondering, “well if they are illegal then why is the site working?” Wake up to you! Look around. Massive tech companies do wrong stuff and just get fined. At a certain size, a company generally will just exist and it’s up to consumers to cancel the company. This is why cancelling exists now and so do sites like trust pilot. Grailed is a total scam. Their phone number is a bizarre voicemail. The sellers are all con artists who have these weird networks where they conjure up goods at a low price and mark it 20x to you - proven by any customs form you’ll have when you get a product delivered. There are no longer the original scenarios of individuals who genuinely want to connect over fashion, blah blah. Think uber, Airbnb and all the abuses they did as they got larger. grailed is a dirty sick company. It doesn’t need to exist. eBay and then goat and others are there. Let’s get this sick twisted company and it’s scumbag network closed for good. Avoid or simply lose your time and money
